questions.title: Question 2 for Class 190911
questions.main: What are the main factors that determine seasonal temperature variations?
questions.answer: The elevation angle of the Sun dictates how much energy will be available to warm the ground.  The elevation angle depends on the time of year and is influenced by the tilt of the Earth.

questions.title: Question 3 for Class 190911
questions.main: Michigan Stadium contains multiple materials from the grass(?) on the field to the concrete and metal of the seats. On top of that it has multiple slopes which will increase or decrease the sunlight exposure around the stadium. We will be visiting Michigan Stadium on a hopefully sunny day to be determined to make measurements of the temperatures around the bowl of the stadium. What spot in the stadium would you expect to have the warmest surface?
questions.answer: Virtually any answer is OK as long as it's in the stadium amd likely in the sunshine.

questions.title: Question 4 for Class 190911
questions.main: The winds in Ann Arbor typically blow from which direction?

questions.title: Question 5 for Class 190911
questions.main: The earth is tilted at an angle of 23.5 degrees  with respect to the plane of its orbit  around the sun.  If the amount of tilt were increased to 40 degrees  we would expect in middle latitudes:
questions.answer: A) hotter summers and colder winters than at present

mcq.option: A) hotter summers and colder winters than at present
B) cooler summers and milder winters than at present
C) hotter summers and milder winters than at present
D) cooler summers and colder winters than at present
E) no appreciable change from present conditions

questions.title: Question 6 for Class 190911
questions.main: Which of the following cities is at the same latitude as Ann Arbor?

questions.title: Question 7 for Class 190911
questions.main: To see a sundog you should look about 22 degrees:
questions.answer: A) to the right or left of the sun

mcq.option: A) to the right or left of the sun

questions.title: Question 8 for Class 190911
questions.main: Which of the following cities is at the same longitude as Ann Arbor?

questions.title: Question 9 for Class 190911
questions.main: Why is it very unlikely that you will ever experience a temperature of 90 degrees F with a relative humidity of 90 percent?
questions.answer: A temperature of 90 degrees F and a relative humidity of 90 percent can occur only if the dew-point temperature is very high (nearly 87 degrees F) and a dew-point temperature this high rarely occurs in the United States even on the muggiest of days.

questions.title: Question 10 for Class 190911
questions.main: Explain why the warmest time of the day is usually in the afternoon even though the sun's rays are most direct at noon.
questions.answer: At noon the energy being received from the Sun is still greater than what the ground is emitting as longwave radiation.  Hence there is an energy surplus and temperatures will rise until later in the day when incoming and outgoing radiation are equal.
